item.title: TDK backs Ultraviolette with $21M to take India-made electric motorcycles global
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Ultraviolette aims to expand its electric motorcycles to 40 European countries, as well as Latin America and Southeast Asia.

item.title: Pronto’s 10-minute house help pitch sparked a 3.6x valuation jump in just 90 days
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Pronto has raised $11 million in an all-equity Series A round co-led by General Catalyst and Glade Brook Capital at a post-money valuation of $45 million.

item.title: Seoul-based Datumo raises $15.5M to take on Scale AI, backed by Salesforce
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Datumo began as an AI data labeling company and now wants to help businesses build safer AI with tools and data that enable testing, monitoring, and improving their models — without requiring technical expertise.

item.title: Slow Ventures cuts first check from $60M creator fund into woodworking founder
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: This marks the first investment for Slow’s $60 million Creator Fund since its launch in February. The fund looks to help creators launch businesses, under the belief that what made them successful influencers is what can also make them a good founder.

item.title: iOS 26 beta 6 adds new ringtones, snappy app launches, and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The new developer beta release, iOS 26 beta 6, adds new ringtones, faster app launches, and fixes the Camera swipe direction issues.

item.title: Poshmark CEO and founder to step down
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: After nearly 15 years, Manish Chandra will transition to being a member of the board of directors. Namsun Kim, who has served as executive chairman since April, has been appointed as his successor.

item.title: US government seized $1M from Russian ransomware gang
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: A global law enforcement coalition targeted the infrastructure of the group behind the Royal and BlackSuit ransomware strains, allegedly responsible for extorting victims out of $370 million since 2022.

item.title: How founders are ditching VC norms and finding capital on their own terms at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Founders today have more capital paths than ever. But how do you navigate them — and know which one actually supports your growth?

item.title: Ocean’s new app brings inbox triage, tasks, and invites to Gmail users
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Ocean debuts an email app for Gmail users with triage tools, a task manager, and more.

item.title: Made by Google 2025: How to watch Google debut the Pixel 10, Pixel Watch 4, and more
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Google is hosting its Pixel 10 event next week. Learn how to watch the tech giant reveal its new mobile devices and what else you can expect.

item.title: Trump administration stops illegal freeze of $5B EV charger funds after losing in court
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The money is on the table again, but with fewer requirements for proving out safety, environmental impacts, and inclusion of minority- and women-owned businesses.

item.title: GitHub CEO to step down
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The move comes as GitHub is facing growing competition from companies like Google and Cursor over AI tools for programmers.

item.title: iPhone 17, the ‘thinnest iPhone ever,’ and everything else we’re expecting out of Apple’s hardware event
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From a new slim iPhone Air model to redesigned AirPods, here's what to expect from this year's Apple event.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: The triple punch headed for automakers
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Electronic Arts blocks more than 300,000 attempts to cheat after launching Battlefield 6 beta
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Soon after the launch of first-person shooter Battlefield 6, cheaters flooded the games, forcing Electronic Arts to respond.

item.title: Revel shuts down its ride-hail business to focus on EV charging
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Revel has abandoned its small Uber and Lyft competitor four years after it started, and is looking to sell or return its bright-blue Tesla and Kia EVs.

item.title: Nvidia unveils new Cosmos world models, infra for robotics and physical uses
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a set of new world AI models, libraries, and other infrastructure for robotics developers, most notable of which is Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter "reasoning" vision language model for physical AI applications and robots.

item.title: Elon Musk confirms shutdown of Tesla Dojo, ‘an evolutionary dead end’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: “Once it became clear that all paths converged to AI6, I had to shut down Dojo and make some tough personnel choices, as Dojo 2 was now an evolutionary dead end,” Musk posted on X, the social media platform he owns, on Sunday.

item.title: Ford throws out Henry Ford’s assembly line to make low-cost EVs in America
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The automaker is investing $2 billion into the Louisville Assembly Plant with a $30,000 EV pickup slated for 2027.

item.title: Nvidia, AMD may sell high-end AI chips to China if they pay US a cut
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The global AI chip race narrative used to be about U.S. national security, but apparently now it's about tariffs: Nvidia and AMD have agreed to pay the U.S. government 15% of the revenue they make from sales of high-end AI chips to China in exchange for licenses to sell those chips in the country, the Financial Times reported, citing anonymous sources.
